paper_abstract: A graph G is 2-outerplanar if it has a planar embedding such that the subgraph obtained by removing the vertices of the outer face is outerplanar. The oriented chromatic number of an oriented graph H is defined as the minimum order of an oriented graph H' such that H has a homomorphism to H'. In this paper, we prove that 2-outerplanar graphs are 4-degenerate. We also show that oriented 2-outerplanar graphs have a homornorphism to the Paley tournament QR(67), which implies that their (strong) oriented chromatic number is at most 67. (c) 2006 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
